prompts.prompt_text: “Track all my important meetings and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Track all my important meetings and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: track important meetings and flag those requiring focus time for preparation. Identify constraints such as importance criteria and preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all upcoming calendar events within a relevant timeframe (e.g., next 2-4 weeks) to analyze importance and preparation requirements.
execution_plan.note: Provides the raw data set of meetings for further classification and analysis.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from each event such as attendees, RSVP status, agenda, attachments, and notes to help assess importance and preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step enabling deeper analysis of meeting context and preparation requirements.

execution_plan.description: Classify meetings by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client call) to help determine which meetings are likely to be important and require preparation.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification based on meeting structure and format.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting using metadata, attendees, and context to identify which meetings are 'important'.
execution_plan.note: Subjective evaluation to determine which meetings matter most.

execution_plan.description: Estimate preparation time required for each important meeting based on complexity, number of attendees, and presence of attachments or agenda.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings require significant focus time for preparation.

execution_plan.description: Match identified important meetings and their preparation needs against user preferences and priorities to finalize which should be flagged.
execution_plan.note: Ensures flagged meetings align with user-defined importance and focus criteria.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fall back to basic event details; if importance assessment fails, flag based on meeting type as a heuristic.

prompts.prompt_text: “Help me understand where I am spending my time .and identify ways I can reclaim time to focus more on my top priorities.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Help me understand where I am spending my time .and identify ways I can reclaim time to focus more on my top priorities.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: analyze time allocation and suggest ways to reclaim time for top priorities. Identify constraints such as focus on priorities and optimization goals.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for a relevant timeframe (e.g., past few weeks or month) to analyze time distribution.
execution_plan.note: Provides the raw data needed for time analysis and prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, RSVP status, duration, and meeting notes to support classification and importance assessment.
execution_plan.note: Enables deeper analysis of meeting context and supports downstream tasks like classification and importance scoring.

execution_plan.description: Classify meetings by format (1:1, team sync, customer call, etc.) to understand structural patterns in time allocation.
execution_plan.note: Helps identify which types of meetings dominate the user's schedule.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to determine which are aligned with top priorities and which are candidates for reduction or elimination.
execution_plan.note: Critical for identifying low-value meetings that can be reclaimed.

execution_plan.description: Aggregate time spent across different meeting types and importance levels to quantify where time is being allocated.
execution_plan.note: Provides the analytical foundation for identifying reclaimable time.

execution_plan.description: Generate visualizations (charts, graphs) to show patterns of time usage and highlight areas for optimization.
execution_plan.note: Helps the user easily understand time allocation and identify trends.

execution_plan.description: Generate personalized recommendations on how to reclaim time, such as reducing low-importance meetings or consolidating similar sessions.
execution_plan.note: Delivers actionable insights aligned with the user's stated priorities.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If visualization fails, still provide textual summary; retry data retrieval if initial attempt fails.

prompts.prompt_text: “Starting next week, I want a weekly 30-min 1:1 with {name}. Afternoons preferred, avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Starting next week, I want a weekly 30-min 1:1 with {name}. Afternoons preferred, avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.”

execution_plan.description: Parse user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring 1:1), constraints (weekly, 30-min, afternoons, avoid Fridays, start next week), attendee ({name}), and auto-reschedule requirement.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve {name} to a specific contact in the directory, handle any ambiguity.
execution_plan.note: Ensures the correct person is invited to the 1:1 meeting.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve both user's and attendee's calendar events for the relevant timeframe (starting next week onward) to check availability and conflicts.
execution_plan.note: Required to identify free slots and avoid conflicts.

execution_plan.description: Check free/busy status for both parties, considering constraints (afternoons, avoid Fridays) to find suitable slots.
execution_plan.note: Ensures the meeting is scheduled at a mutually available time.

execution_plan.description: Apply optimization to select the best slot that satisfies all constraints (weekly recurrence, 30-min duration, afternoons, avoid Fridays).
execution_plan.note: Handles complex scheduling constraints.

execution_plan.description: Generate RRULE for weekly recurring meeting starting next week.
execution_plan.note: Creates the recurrence pattern for the 1:1 meeting.

execution_plan.description: Create the recurring 1:1 meeting event with resolved attendee, selected slot, and recurrence rule.
execution_plan.note: Schedules the meeting in the calendar.

execution_plan.description: Set up workflow to automatically reschedule the meeting if declines or conflicts occur in the future.
execution_plan.note: Implements the auto-reschedule requirement from the prompt.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 2 and 3 could partially overlap after NLU output, but dependency on attendee resolution suggests sequential execution for accuracy.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification. If no available slots found, escalate with alternative suggestions.

prompts.prompt_text: “Clear my Thursday afternoon. Update my RSVPs and help me reschedule my meetings to another time and show me as {status}.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Clear my Thursday afternoon. Update my RSVPs and help me reschedule my meetings to another time and show me as {status}.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: clear Thursday afternoon, update RSVPs, reschedule meetings, and set status. Identify constraints such as timeframe (Thursday afternoon) and desired status.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable details.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events scheduled for Thursday afternoon to identify which meetings need to be cleared or rescheduled.
Extract metadata for the retrieved events, including RSVP status, attendees, and logistics, to support RSVP updates and rescheduling.
execution_plan.note: Required for RSVP updates and understanding meeting details.

execution_plan.description: Update RSVP statuses for meetings being cleared or rescheduled as per user intent.
Check availability for the user and attendees to find alternative time slots for rescheduling the cleared meetings.
execution_plan.note: Depends on calendar retrieval and attendee info from metadata.

execution_plan.description: Apply scheduling constraints to identify optimal new times for the meetings, considering user availability and preferences.
Handle any conflicts or unsatisfiable constraints during rescheduling by applying trade-offs or escalation logic.
execution_plan.note: Specialized task triggered by rescheduling requirement.

execution_plan.description: Update the calendar by removing or moving meetings from Thursday afternoon to the newly selected time slots and set the user's status as requested.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 5 and 6 could partially overlap if availability checks for multiple attendees are parallelized internally.
orchestration.error_handling: Retry failed API calls for calendar updates; if rescheduling fails, notify user with unresolved conflicts and suggest manual intervention.

prompts.prompt_text: “Land a time to meet about Project Alpha with Chris, Sangya, and Kat for 1 hour in the next 2 weeks. Schedule over 1:1s and lunches if needed and work around Kat’s schedule. Make the meeting in person and add a room.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Land a time to meet about Project Alpha with Chris, Sangya, and Kat for 1 hour in the next 2 weeks. Schedule over 1:1s and lunches if needed and work around Kat’s schedule. Make the meeting in person and add a room.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule a meeting), constraints (1 hour, next 2 weeks, in-person, add room), attendees (Chris, Sangya, Kat), priorities (schedule over 1:1s and lunches, work around Kat’s schedule).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names (Chris, Sangya, Kat) to their calendar identities and ensure correct email addresses or directory entries.
Retrieve the user's calendar events and attendees’ calendars for the next 2 weeks to check availability and conflicts.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as meeting types, attendees, and whether they are 1:1s or lunches to prioritize scheduling over them if needed.
execution_plan.note: Enables classification and prioritization of existing meetings.

execution_plan.description: Classify existing meetings (e.g., 1:1s, lunches, team meetings) to identify which can be deprioritized or overridden.
Assess the importance of existing meetings to determine which can be rescheduled or deprioritized in favor of the new meeting.
Check free/busy status for all attendees across the next 2 weeks and identify potential time slots for the new meeting.
Apply constraints (1-hour duration, in-person, add room, prioritize over 1:1s and lunches, work around Kat’s schedule) to select the optimal time slot.
Book an appropriate meeting room for the in-person meeting.
Create the new calendar event for Project Alpha with the selected time slot, attendees, and booked room.

parallelization_opportunities: Step 5 (CAN-02A) and Step 6 (CAN-02B) can run in parallel after Step 4
orchestration.error_handling: If room booking fails, notify user and suggest virtual option; retry availability check if attendee calendars fail to load.

prompts.prompt_text: “Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha with the product and marketing team to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha with the product and marketing team to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create agenda), meeting context (Project Alpha), participants (product and marketing team), objectives (review progress, confirm on track, discuss blockers/risks).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured constraints.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'product team' and 'marketing team' into actual attendee lists by querying directory or team definitions.
execution_plan.note: Ensures correct participants are identified for agenda preparation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing scheduled meetings related to Project Alpha with these teams to determine if agenda applies to an existing meeting or a new one.
execution_plan.note: Needed to check if there is an upcoming meeting for which the agenda should be set.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from the identified meeting(s): attendees, RSVP status, notes, attachments, and any existing agenda items.
execution_plan.note: Provides context for agenda creation and ensures alignment with existing meeting details.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured agenda document including sections: progress review, confirmation of being on track, discussion of blocking issues and risks.
execution_plan.note: Creates the actual agenda content using templates and extracted objectives.

execution_plan.description: Analyze previous meetings and project notes to anticipate potential objections, risks, or blockers to include in the agenda discussion points.
execution_plan.note: Adds proactive risk discussion items to the agenda.

execution_plan.description: Attach the generated agenda to the identified meeting or create a new meeting if none exists, ensuring attendees and objectives are included.
execution_plan.note: Final step to ensure the agenda is linked to the appropriate calendar event.

parallelization_opportunities: Step 5 (agenda generation) and Step 6 (risk anticipation) could run in parallel after Step 4 metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If no existing meeting is found, fallback to creating a new event; retry attendee resolution if ambiguous names detected.

prompts.prompt_text: “Review the materials for my meeting with senior leadership and suggest the best way to summarize the topics into three main discussion points. Generate any objections or concerns that might come up and give me effective responses.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Review the materials for my meeting with senior leadership and suggest the best way to summarize the topics into three main discussion points. Generate any objections or concerns that might come up and give me effective responses.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify the target meeting (senior leadership), required actions (review materials, summarize into three points, anticipate objections, generate responses).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable details.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve upcoming calendar events to locate the meeting with senior leadership.
execution_plan.note: Needed to find the specific meeting and its associated data.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for the identified meeting: attendees, attachments, notes, and any linked documents.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to access meeting materials and context.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all attachments and pre-read materials associated with the senior leadership meeting.
execution_plan.note: Required to review the actual content before summarization.

execution_plan.description: Analyze retrieved materials and generate a concise summary with three main discussion points.
execution_plan.note: Transforms raw materials into structured talking points.

execution_plan.description: Analyze meeting context and materials to anticipate potential objections or concerns from senior leadership and generate effective responses.
execution_plan.note: Specialized task triggered by 'anticipate objections' requirement.

orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, provide a fallback summary based on meeting metadata; retry failed retrieval steps before proceeding.

prompts.prompt_text: “Prepare a brief for my upcoming meeting with customer Beta and include a dossier for each customer attendee and the topics they are most interested in. Include a background on their company.”

analysis.prompt_text: “Prepare a brief for my upcoming meeting with customer Beta and include a dossier for each customer attendee and the topics they are most interested in. Include a background on their company.”

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (prepare meeting brief), identify target meeting (with customer Beta), and required outputs (dossier for each attendee, topics of interest, company background).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve upcoming calendar events to locate the meeting with customer Beta.
execution_plan.note: Needed to find the specific meeting details from the user's calendar.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for the identified meeting, including attendees, RSVP status, and any attached documents.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable attendee resolution and document retrieval.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names to directory entries and enrich with contact details for dossier creation.
execution_plan.note: Required to gather accurate attendee information for personalized dossiers.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any pre-reads or shared documents attached to the meeting that may inform the brief.
execution_plan.note: Provides additional context for the meeting brief.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured meeting brief including: meeting overview, attendee dossiers, topics of interest, and company background.
execution_plan.note: Core step to produce the requested output document.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but typically sequential for data dependencies.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, proceed with available names; if document retrieval fails, generate brief without attachments.
